title: Mohamed Salah was asked why Sadio Mane wanted to "hit him" in Liverpool changing room
text:

Georginio Wijnaldum broke the tension between Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane by asking the Egyptian "Why did Mane want to hit you?"

Mane was furious with Liverpool team-mate Salah following the 3-0 win over Burnley in August after the Golden Boot winner refused to set him up to score.

Salah instead went for goal and failed to increase Liverpool's advantage, despite Mane being unmarked and in a better position than him.

Jurgen Klopp hooked Mane shortly after the passage of play and the Senegalese forward reacted furious upon leaving the pitch.

In the changing room after the match Holland international Wijnaldum broke the tension.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"Everyone was taking the p*** out of us," said Mane on Canal Plus.

"[Georginio] Wijnaldum, who likes to tease people, waited until everyone was there, came up to me and asked out loud 'Mo Salah, why did Mane want to hit you?' and the whole team started laughing."

(Image: PETER POWELL/EPA-EFE/REX)

Mane and Salah discussed the issue between themselves and eventually put the spat behind them.

"He said to me 'Sadio, why are you angry?' I told him 'You needed to give me the ball, Mo', to which he replied 'I didn't see you. You know I've got nothing against you'," added Mane.

(Image: PA)

"We talk on the phone sometimes, we text each other and we don't have a problem. So we talked, and everything was like before.

"We talked between ourselves, and then the manager called me into his office and we spoke. I told him it was already sorted and he was pleasantly surprised."
description: Sadio Mane was furious with Liverpool team-mate Mohamed Salah following the 3-0 win over Burnley in August
